FuncDef:
The ftp ipv6 client-source command sets and source addresses of the FTP client to establish the connection with FTP server.
The undo ftp ipv6 client-source command cancels the source address of the FTP client. The ftp ipv6 client-source command sets and source addresses of the FTP client to establish the connection with FTP server. The undo ftp ipv6 client-source command cancels the source address of the FTP client. By default, the source address contains all 0s.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the IPv6 address of the local device.
The value is a 32-digit hexadecimal number, in the format of X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Specifies the name of the VPN instance to which the FTP server belongs.
Before specifying vpn-instance <ipv6-vpn-instance-name>, ensure that a VPN instance has been configured.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

ExtraInfo: If you run the ftp command to log in to an FTP server without specifying a source IPv6 address, the source address that is specified through the ftp client-source command is adopted by default.If you run the ftp command and specify a source IPv6 address, the specified source IPv6 address is adopted.
